definition: two/both/some/a few/tael, unit of weight equal to 50 grams (modern) or 1⁄16 of a catty 斤[jin1] (old)
no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); without any way out of a dilemma/trapped/in an impossible situation
dilemma/quandary/Scylla and Charybdis/between the devil and the deep blue sea (idiom)
to be on the horns of a dilemma (idiom)

sentences.english: It is a true dilemma," wrote Moon Chang-keuk, a columnist at South Korea's JoongAng Ilbo newspaper.
sentences.chinese: 所以這是一個實實在在的兩難。

sentences.english: Philosophers have posed this moral dilemma for decades.
sentences.chinese: 哲學家們提出這樣的一個道德兩難已經很多年了。

sentences.english: Dr Goh recalled the dilemma he faced before carrying out the operation.
sentences.chinese: 高醫生回想起做手術前所面對的兩難。

sentences.english: Friends and even casual acquaintances will hold the keys to a dilemma you are trying to unknot .
sentences.chinese: 朋友和熟人，甚至隨意將舉行的鑰匙，一個兩難你想。

sentences.english: Tassels on the horns of a dilemma, back to the husbands family and no steps, had to find treasure complex complaint.
sentences.chinese: 流蘇進退兩難，回婆家又沒臺階，只得找寶絡訴苦。

sentences.english: Teachers are indeed caught in a dilemma.
sentences.chinese: 老師確實陷入進退兩難的境地。

sentences.english: Looking market outlook, policy frequent positive side, up and down the market short - term dilemma.
sentences.chinese: 展望後市，政策面利好頻出，大盤短期上下兩難。

sentences.english: Rural education is being confronted with its value dilemma of de- ruralization or pro- ruralization.
sentences.chinese: 農村教育面臨着去農化與向農化的兩難價值選擇。

sentences.english: Was there ever a genuine dilemma?
sentences.chinese: 真的曾有過兩難之境嗎？

sentences.english: On the other hand, this gives us a dilemma.
sentences.chinese: 另一方面，這讓我們陷入兩難困境。

sentences.english: So Kay has been in a dilemma.
sentences.chinese: 所以，Kay陷入了進退兩難的窘境。
也有許多人都面臨着這樣的進退兩難的處境。

sentences.english: If that's true, that would add a whole new ethical quandary.
sentences.chinese: 如果這是真的，那就真的在道德上陷入兩難的境地。

sentences.english: I can't stop crying in a dilemma of loving you or distrusting you.
sentences.chinese: 我在你給我的矛盾兩難的叉路口，不停的哭泣。

sentences.english: Wang Fang found herself in a dilemma.
sentences.chinese: 王芳發現自己陷入了進退兩難的地步。

sentences.english: THE debt crisis has presented investors with an extremely awkward dilemma.
sentences.chinese: 債務危機使投資者陷入困窘的兩難境地。

definition: not knowing which course to follow (idiom); at a loss what to do
(of an illness, debt etc) to plague sb/to preoccupy sb/difficult to get rid of
cage/trap (e.g. basket, pit or snare for catching animals)/fig. bonds (of wrong ideas)/shackles (of past misconceptions)/to trap/to shackle
no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); without any way out of a dilemma/trapped/in an impossible situation
variant of 動蕩|动荡[dong4 dang4]
